content.description: Marked out in orange in the picture. Start at US, then traverse left, passing the heart and staying low on the wall. Begin ascending once you approach the moss to your right. Top out.
Start to the left of Budding Boulder and go through the tree and top out to the left of the highest point on the rock.
content.location: Left side of Heart of Stone

content.description: Marked out in yellow in the picture. Start at US, then head left. The "checkpoint" is the patio low to the ground to your left, on which you must get both your feet to send this route. From there, head directly up the wall, passing over the part of the wall bulging out (like a chest with a heart beating hard). Top out.
Marked out in red in the picture. Route starts with hands matched on US. From there, head 5 ft to the right, then climb directly up through the heart and top out.
Start directly left of the start for Heartthrob with a sit a start, make your way left through part of the budding tree and top out a little bit right of the highest point of the rock.
content.location: Heart of Stone rock. Start a foot or two left of Heartthrob and go up to the left.

content.description:
Small wall a little past Upper Lip, on the right of the trail. Once past Upper Lip, look for a small boulder directly next to the path; then go straight into the woods for 20m. The name comes from a collection of holds in the middle of the wall resembling the outline of a heart.

 Relatively easy climbing, and a wall I would recommend to beginners to get more comfortable with bouldering in general.

 US = Universal Start, as all the current routes on the wall begin here, with matched hands.
